posts.post_content:
**Each *Time Spiral* card was an homage to at least one previously printed card.**  
  
This card references [Hyalopterous Lemure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hyalopterous Lemure) in ability and flavor text. Famously, artist Richard Thomas misread *lemure* (a French word for *ghost*) with *lemur*, the primitive, bushy-tailed monkey. This same mistake is being made by our favorite coward, [Norin the Wary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Norin the Wary), in the flavor text.
posts.html:
Each Time Spiral card was an homage to at least one previously printed card.

This card references Hyalopterous Lemure in ability and flavor text. Famously, artist Richard Thomas misread lemure (a French word for ghost) with lemur, the primitive, bushy-tailed monkey. This same mistake is being made by our favorite coward, Norin the Wary, in the flavor text.
Report Abuse

Rating:

posts.post_content: Is there a way to make use of the fact that this can be a -1000000/3 creature?
posts.html:
Is there a way to make use of the fact that this can be a -1000000/3 creature?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: sweetgab (7/28/2013 8:48:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Replying to sweetgab's question: Yes. [Ichor Explosion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ichor Explosion), sacrificing it, gives any amount of power and toughness increase (the negative of a negative number is a positive number).
posts.html:
Replying to sweetgab's question: Yes. Ichor Explosion, sacrificing it, gives any amount of power and toughness increase (the negative of a negative number is a positive number).

Posted By: Kirbster (11/5/2012 9:45:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: They printed this card to reference the gaffe on Hyalopterous Lemure's art. The original card wasn't popular, but it was notable that the artist mistook what was supposed to be an evil spirit for a flying monkey.
posts.html:
